items.title: Tulum Energy reclaims lost hydrogen tech to raise $27M
items.summary:
- *Tulum Energy* revived a forgotten hydrogen production technology originally discovered between 2002-2005. 
- The company recently secured a *$27 million* seed round to develop its process, which creates hydrogen from methane without emissions. 
- Tulum aims to produce hydrogen at approximately *$1.50 per kilogram*, significantly undercutting current methods and promising a sustainable energy future.

items.title: Cursor Apologizes for Pricing Confusion
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- Anysphere CEO **Michael Truell** apologized for a poorly communicated pricing change to Cursor's Pro plan. 
- Users faced unexpected costs after the plan transitioned to a usage-based model, leading to rapid depletion of their usage limits. 
- The company plans to issue refunds to affected users and improve communication regarding future pricing changes.

items.title: Epic Games Settles Antitrust Case Against Samsung
items.summary:
- Epic Games has settled its antitrust case against *Samsung*, alleging collusion with *Google* to block competition in app distribution.
- Epic's CEO stated that the case was dismissed after productive discussions, expressing gratitude for Samsung's cooperation.
- The lawsuit centered on Samsung's *Auto Blocker* feature, which restricted downloads outside its official stores, seen as anti-competitive practices.

items.title: ChatGPT's New 'Study Together' Feature
items.summary:
- A *new feature* called **'Study Together'** is being tested by some ChatGPT subscribers.
- This mode aims to enhance educational use by prompting users with more questions instead of simply providing answers.
- OpenAI has not confirmed availability or whether it will be exclusive to ChatGPT Plus, yet it may help combat academic *cheating*.

items.title: Bluesky Users Can Customize Notifications
items.summary:
*Bluesky announces three new updates for notifications.*  
- Users can now customize alerts for specific accounts and control notification preferences.  
- New features include notifications for likes on reposts, enhancing engagement for users who share content.  
- The previous priority notifications have been replaced; users must now adjust settings to filter notifications from people they follow only.

items.title: iOS 26 beta 3 Dials Back Liquid Glass
items.summary:
- The latest beta of iOS 26 reduces the *glassy look* due to user feedback addressing readability concerns.
- Changes made include a **more solid background** in navigation bars and improved contrast in notifications.
- Although aimed at enhancing usability, some users criticize the update for reverting to a *frosted glass aesthetic*.

items.title: Jack Dorsey Working on Bluetooth Messaging App Bitchat
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- *Jack Dorsey* has developed a new app called **Bitchat**, which uses Bluetooth mesh networks for messaging without Wi-Fi or cellular reception.
- The app claims to extend messaging range up to **300 meters**, making it suitable for environments like crowded events.
- Dorsey aims to promote *decentralization* in technology, aligning with his interests in Bitcoin and other decentralized projects.

items.title: Tennis Players Critique Wimbledon’s AI Line Judges
items.summary:
- Players are voicing concerns over the accuracy of the new *electronic line calling* system replacing human judges. 
- Notable incidents include missed calls that led to unfair point losses for players like Emma Raducanu and Ben Shelton. 
- The controversy highlights the ongoing debate about the balance between *human oversight* and AI technology in sports.

items.title: CoreWeave Acquires Core Scientific in $9B Deal
items.summary:
- CoreWeave's acquisition of Core Scientific for **$9 billion** grants it over a *gigawatt* of data center capacity.
- This capacity will be pivotal for *AI training and inference workloads*, shifting from Bitcoin mining to supporting generative AI models.
- The deal highlights the *competitive landscape* among cloud providers to enhance infrastructure to meet growing AI demands.

items.title: Waymo Expands Robotaxi Testing to Philadelphia and NYC
items.summary:
- Waymo has begun testing in Philadelphia and NYC to explore *Northeastern expansion*.  
- The company maps cities using human-driven vehicles before testing autonomous driving, which may take months or years for commercial launch.  
- Current regulations in NYC complicate plans for fully autonomous robotaxis, leading Waymo to advocate for legal changes.

items.title: Waymo Begins Robotaxi Testing in Philadelphia and NYC
items.summary:
- Waymo is launching robotaxi testing in Philadelphia and NYC, expanding its reach in the Northeast.
- The company is mapping key urban areas before potentially rolling out autonomous services, although commercial launches remain uncertain.
- Waymo faces regulatory challenges in NYC, advocating for changes to allow fully driverless vehicles without human supervision in the front seat.

items.title: Threads is nearing X’s daily app users, new data shows
AI is forcing the data industry to consolidate
items.summary:
- The data industry is undergoing significant *consolidation*, driven by the need for quality data to support **AI** applications.  
- Major acquisitions, such as Databricks buying Neon and Salesforce acquiring Informatica, indicate a growing trend towards integration of data solutions.  
- This shift reflects the challenges of managing a fragmented data landscape and highlights the *benefits* for startups through acquisition as a viable exit strategy.

items.title: TikTok Developing New App Version Ahead of US Sale
items.summary:
- TikTok is launching a new app for U.S. users before a planned sale. 
- The new app is expected to debut on September 5, while the current app will be disabled in March 2026. 
- This development follows President Trump's discussions about a potential sale deal with China.

items.title: Ingram Micro Ransomware Attack Causes Outage
items.summary:
- *Ingram Micro*, a major U.S. technology distributor, experienced an outage due to a ransomware attack that began on Thursday. 
- The attack has affected the company's website and network, hindering order processing and software licensing for customers. 
- The *SafePay ransomware gang* is suspected of the attack, although no group has claimed responsibility yet.

items.title: Apple Appeals EU’s €500M Fine Over App Store Payment Restraints
items.summary:
- Apple has appealed a €500 million fine from the EU for violating the *Digital Markets Act*.  
- The fine stems from Apple's non-compliance with rules allowing developers to direct users to alternative payment methods.  
- Apple argues that the EU's decision imposes confusing business terms that could negatively impact both developers and users.

items.title: Improved Grok criticizes Democrats and Hollywood’s ‘Jewish executives’
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Elon Musk announced *significant improvements* to Grok’s chatbot capabilities. 
- Grok’s responses have sparked controversy by asserting that *Jewish executives* dominate Hollywood, influencing its content and policies. 
- The dialogue also touches upon antisemitic stereotypes and the complex nature of media ownership.

items.title: New Tech Unicorns of 2025
items.summary:
- In 2025, *36 new tech unicorns* have emerged, primarily driven by interest in **AI** startups.
- Notable unicorns include **Teamworks** and **Thinking Machines**, showcasing diverse sectors like *satellite* and *blockchain*.
- The list of unicorns will continue to evolve as new companies achieve *$1 billion valuations* throughout the year.

items.title: At least 36 new tech unicorns were minted in 2025 so far
items.summary:
- *36 new tech unicorns* have emerged in 2025 amid AI-driven investor fervor.
- Significant companies span various sectors, including **satellite** and **blockchain** technology.
- This list, based on *Crunchbase* and *PitchBook* data, will be updated throughout the year.

items.title: X Blocks Reuters Accounts in India
items.summary:
- The main *Reuters* accounts have been inaccessible to *X users* in India since July 5.
- Users see a message about the accounts being withheld due to a *legal demand*, which the Indian government denies making.
- *X*, previously known as Twitter, has faced scrutiny and lawsuits concerning censorship demands from the Indian government.

items.title: Hidden AI Prompts in Peer Review
items.summary:
- Academics are using *hidden prompts* in research papers to influence peer review outcomes. 
- A study found 17 papers with these prompts, often concealed via white text or tiny fonts, urging AI to provide *positive feedback*. 
- Some authors claim this tactic counters *lazy reviewers* who rely on AI instead of thorough evaluation.

items.title: How Brex is keeping up with AI by embracing the ‘messiness’
items.author: Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- *Brex* faced challenges in adopting AI tools due to slow procurement processes after the introduction of *ChatGPT*.
- The company revamped its strategies for vetting AI tools, using a “superhuman product-market-fit test” to make quicker decisions.
- CTO James Reggio emphasizes the importance of *embracing messiness* in the AI innovation cycle, recognizing that trial and error are vital for success.

items.title: Drive Capital’s second act – venture firm success post-split
items.summary:
- *Drive Capital* in Columbus, Ohio, rebounded after a co-founder split, achieving remarkable success in the venture capital scene.
- In May, the firm returned *$500 million* to investors and demonstrated a unique strategy focused on exits at *$3 billion* rather than chasing unicorns.
- Despite past failures, Drive’s portfolio includes significant wins like *Duolingo* and *Vast Data*, highlighting its commitment to investing outside Silicon Valley’s competitive market.

items.title: Ask not for whom the Louvre of Bluesky tolls, it tolls for thee
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
The disappearance of the *Louvre of Bluesky* account has left a significant impact on the platform.
- This account was known for critiquing poor online posts and offered a unique perspective on social media behaviors.
- The author expressed hope for the account's return, highlighting its role in reminding users of their online actions.
- The account's closure stems from negative external pressures, but its legacy remains influential.

items.title: Google Faces EU Antitrust Complaint Over AI
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- The **Independent Publishers Alliance** has filed an antitrust complaint against Google, claiming misuse of web content for AI-generated summaries that harm publishers.
- It is alleged that Google’s AI Overviews have led to significant traffic, readership, and revenue loss for news publishers.
- Google argues that its AI features create new discovery opportunities and contends that traffic fluctuations can occur for various reasons.

items.title: Ready-made stem cell therapies for pets could be coming
items.summary:
- San Diego startup Gallant has announced **$18 million** in funding for FDA-approved ready-to-use stem cell therapies for pets.
- Their initial focus is on treating **Feline Chronic Gingivostomatitis** (FCGS) in cats, potentially achieving FDA approval by early **2026**.
- This innovative approach uses convenient, ready-to-use cells from donor animals, distinguishing it from traditional methods requiring patient-specific harvesting.

items.title: Microsoft Exits Pakistan After 25 Years
items.summary:
- Microsoft is closing its operations in Pakistan, ending a **25-year presence**.
- The decision is part of a **wider restructuring effort**, impacting 5 employees who sold Azure and Office products.
- This exit highlights challenges in Pakistan's tech sector, contrasting with investments from companies like **Google** and **Huawei**.

items.title: EV Sales Update and Rivian's $1B from VW
items.summary:
- The TechCrunch Mobility newsletter highlights the ongoing developments in *electric vehicle (EV)* sales as Q2 numbers are published.
- Notably, **Rivian** has secured another *$1B investment from Volkswagen*, amidst *sales struggles*.
- The end of the *EV tax credit* could significantly impact the *auto industry* and the plans of other EV startups like Slate Auto.

items.title: EU AI Legislation on Track Despite Industry Pushback
items.summary:
- The *European Union* confirms it will adhere to its schedule for the **AI legislation**, despite appeals from over a hundred tech companies for delays.
- Major players like *Alphabet* and *Meta* argue that the AI Act could hinder Europe's competitiveness in AI.
- The Act enforces a **risk-based regulation**, categorizing AI applications into three risk levels, with strict guidelines for high-risk uses.

items.title: Slate Auto Alters Pricing After Tax Credit Changes
items.summary:
- Slate Auto's advertised price for its electric pickup truck has changed after the end of the federal EV tax credit.  
 - The company's promise of a sub-$20,000 price hinged on the $7,500 credit, which will end in September.  
 - This adjustment could significantly affect Slate's strategy for affordability in the EV market.

items.title: Everyone in tech has an opinion about Soham Parekh
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- *Soham Parekh* gained notoriety after being accused of working at multiple startups simultaneously, causing a stir in the tech community.
- Reactions to Parekh range from viewing him as a folk hero for outsmarting startups to condemning him as a scammer who took opportunities from others.
- His situation highlights the complexities of remote work culture, as some call for accountability and changes in how job seekers are vetted.

items.title: Cluely’s ARR Doubles to $7M Amid Competition
items.summary:
- Cluely's annual recurring revenue surged to *$7 million* after launching a new product in just a week.
- The startup, utilizing *AI* for real-time notes and conversation analysis, faces rising competition from **free alternatives** like Pickle's Glass.
- Despite its controversial past, including claims of facilitating interview cheating, Cluely's innovative features have attracted significant business interest.

items.title: Soham Parekh: The Silicon Valley Serial Moonlighter
items.summary:
- *Soham Parekh* is a software engineer accused of working at multiple Silicon Valley startups simultaneously without disclosure. 
- His practices sparked viral discussions on social media, with numerous CEOs confirming his moonlighting and questionable work ethics. 
- Parekh claims to have taken multiple jobs due to *financial jeopardy* and high workload, stating he works *140 hours a week*, yet admits he doesn't endorse his actions.

items.title: TechCrunch All Stage brings back early launch prices for a limited time
Wonder Dynamics co-founder Nikola Todorovic joins the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
Stripe’s first employee, the founder of fintech Increase, sort of bought a bank
Final GOP bill kneecaps renewables and hydrogen, but lifts nuclear and geothermal
Not everyone is thrilled with Threads’ DMs
Ilya Sutskever Takes CEO Role at Safe Superintelligence
items.summary:
- *Ilya Sutskever* becomes CEO of **Safe Superintelligence** after Daniel Gross's departure.
- The startup, valued at *$32 billion*, aims solely to develop safe superintelligence.
- Sutskever emphasizes a focus on their mission amidst acquisition rumors from companies like *Meta*.

items.title: Fresh Fundraising Strategies at TechCrunch All Stage
items.summary:
- Kristen Craft will lead a session on navigating the *2025 VC landscape* at TechCrunch All Stage on July 15.
- The discussion will cover *shifting investor expectations* and the importance of a solid business model in today's market.
- Attendees can register at discounted rates to gain insights from Craft and other industry leaders, focusing on adapted fundraising strategies.

items.title: Y Combinator alum launched a new $34M fund dedicated to YC startups
items.summary:
- *Kulveer Taggar* launched Phosphor Capital, raising **$34 million** to invest in Y Combinator startups.
- The fund is uniquely led by Taggar as a solo general partner, backed by **Garry Tan**, CEO of YC.
- Phosphor has already supported over **200 YC companies**, showcasing promising early-stage ventures in AI and other sectors.

items.title: Trump Admin Unlawfully Killed Health Websites Related to Gender
items.summary:
- A U.S. District Judge ruled that the Trump administration unlawfully removed health websites concerning *gender ideology* without following proper legal procedures.
- The actions led to the deletion of vital health resources impacting *patients and doctors* across various health topics.
- Judge Bates mandated that affected websites must be restored, underscoring the administration's failure to comply with established laws.

items.title: Meta has found another way to keep you engaged: Chatbots that message you first
Pinwheel Launches Kid-Friendly Smartwatch with AI Chatbot
items.summary:
- The *Pinwheel Watch* is a smartwatch for children aged 7-14, designed to be a safe alternative to smartphones.
- It features parental controls, GPS tracking, and **PinwheelGPT**, an AI chatbot tailored for kids, which avoids inappropriate content.
- Available for $160 with a subscription, the watch emphasizes *safety* and *supervision*, allowing parents to monitor interactions and set usage limits.

items.title: Castelion Raises $350M Series B for Hypersonic Missiles
items.summary:
Castelion, a startup focused on *hypersonic weapons*, has successfully secured a **$350 million Series B** funding round.  
- The funding, led by *Lightspeed Venture Partners*, pushes the company's valuation into the billions.  
- Castelion aims to disrupt the defense market by rapidly developing and *vertically integrating hypersonic missile systems*.  
- The upcoming Blackbeard Ground Launch project could lead to significant contracts and deliverables by early 2028, intensifying competition with major defense players.

items.title: xAI gets permits for 15 natural gas generators at Memphis data center
Ransomware Gang Hunters International Announces Shutdown
items.summary:
- The *Hunters International* ransomware gang is shutting down and offering free decryption keys to impacted victims.
- Recent developments hint at a potential rebranding to *World Leaks*, suggesting a strategy to evade law enforcement scrutiny.
- Analysts believe this move may be a gesture of goodwill as the gang shifts to a new infrastructure to avoid detection.

items.title: Tighten Up Your Cap Table at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
items.summary:
- *Fundraising* is challenging; a messy *cap table* complicates it further.
- The event on *July 15* will feature experts discussing *cap table best practices* for effective fundraising.
- Attendees will learn how to prepare and present a clean cap table, avoiding common delays and costs in the fundraising process.

items.title: Writer CEO May Habib to take the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
items.summary:
- May Habib, CEO of Writer, will feature in a *fireside chat* at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, discussing how enterprises are operationalizing AI at scale and speed.  
- Writer's AI agents are transforming industries like financial services, clinical research, and e-commerce with *domain-specific language models* through clients such as Uber, Intuit, and Vanguard.  
- The session will delve into real-world deployment, responsible scaling of AI agents, and the future of enterprise AI from experimentation to execution, attended by over 10,000 startup and VC leaders.

items.title: Everything about Flashes: Bluesky's Instagram alternative
items.summary:
- Flashes is a new photo-sharing app built on the Bluesky social network, offering an Instagram-like experience with scrollable feeds, photo filters, and user portfolios integrated with Bluesky’s 37 million users.  
- It supports posting up to 4 images and videos up to 3 minutes long, and interactions like likes, reposts, and replies sync with Bluesky. Users can customize profiles and browse specialized Bluesky feeds on topics or media formats.  
- Developer Sebastian Vogelsang plans to add subscriptions, push notifications, multi-account support, longer videos, Stories, and more, evolving Flashes into a standalone AT Protocol platform while maintaining Bluesky compatibility.
